meanings.definition: The action or process of growing inward or into something.
meanings.sent1: The ingrowths of the roots help the plant absorb water and nutrients efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the ingrowths of the hair follicles can cause skin irritation.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowths of the tree roots decided to have a party underground.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like the ingrowths of a vine, slowly creeping into every corner of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowths of the ivy on the old building created a beautiful, green facade.

meanings.definition: A growth that grows inward or into something.
meanings.sent1: She noticed small ingrowths on the crystal, making it sparkle even more.
meanings.sent2: The ingrowths on the rock formation indicated the direction of the underground river.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowths on the cake frosting looked like tiny edible mushrooms.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an ingrowth that touched the hearts of everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowths of moss on the forest floor created a soft, green carpet.

meanings.definition: The result of something growing inward or into something else.
meanings.sent1: The ingrowths of the crystal formation gave it a unique, intricate pattern.
meanings.sent2: The ingrowths of the metal caused the pipe to become clogged.
meanings.sent3: The ingrowths of the vines in the garden seemed to be playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The ingrowths of emotions in her heart made it hard to express how she truly felt.
meanings.sent5: The ingrowths of the roots cracked the pavement, showing nature's strength.
